headline: Fed rate decision, Oracle earnings: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, December 10, including the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, earnings from companies like Oracle (ORCL), Adobe (ADBE), and Synopsys (SNPS). headline: Fed Rate Decision, Adobe and Oracle Earnings: Still to Come This Week
summary: The Federal Reserve will unveil its last rate-setting decision of 2025. A few notable earnings are also due, including Broadcom, Oracle and Adobe, plus retailer Costco. Here's what to expect: Today   Earnings: Adobe, Oracle (üéßmore on the AI trade), Synopsys, Vail Resorts   Economic data: Monthly federal data on deficits/surpluses and delayed quarterly employment cost index   Fed decision: The central bank is expected to cut rates by 0.

headline: Tracking the Adobe Narrative as AI Strategy and Analyst Expectations Shift
summary: Adobe's narrative is shifting as analysts nudge their fair value estimates lower, with the target easing from about $450.32 to $447.56 while the discount rate edges up from roughly 8.53% to 8.59% amid rising uncertainty around the long term growth path. These tweaks reflect a market that still credits Adobe for strong execution and promising AI momentum, but is increasingly cautious about how quickly and durably revenue can grow from here. Long range revenue growth assumptions are trimming...

These tweaks reflect a market that still credits Adobe for strong execution and promising AI momentum, but is increasingly cautious about how quickly and durably revenue can grow from here. Long range revenue growth assumptions are trimming...

headline: Adobe Investors Want More Signs AI Is Driving Growth. Earnings Will Give Insight.
summary: Adobe  earnings will provide more updates to investors who want to see the software platform grow in a competitive market as artificial intelligence becomes more prevalent in the creative space.  Adobe  is scheduled to report fiscal fourth-quarter results after the stock market closes on Wednesday.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect the creative software company to report adjusted earnings of $5.40 a share on revenue of $6.11 billion.

content.title: Adobe Investors Want More Signs AI Is Driving Growth. Earnings Will Give Insight.
content.summary: Adobe  earnings will provide more updates to investors who want to see the software platform grow in a competitive market as artificial intelligence becomes more prevalent in the creative space.  Adobe  is scheduled to report fiscal fourth-quarter results after the stock market closes on Wednesday.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet expect the creative software company to report adjusted earnings of $5.40 a share on revenue of $6.11 billion.

headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.39 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $6.19 billion in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $6.1 billion.

content.title: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.39 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $6.19 billion in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $6.1 billion.

headline: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations, Guides For 9.4% Growth Next Year
summary: Creative software giant Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 10.5% year on year to $6.19 billion. Guidance for next quarter‚Äôs revenue was better than expected at $6.28 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts‚Äô estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.50 per share was 1.9% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

content.title: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations, Guides For 9.4% Growth Next Year
content.summary: Creative software giant Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 10.5% year on year to $6.19 billion. Guidance for next quarter‚Äôs revenue was better than expected at $6.28 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts‚Äô estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.50 per share was 1.9% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

headline: Adobe forecasts annual revenue above estimates
summary: Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue above Wall Street expectations ‚Äãon Wednesday, signaling strong demand ‚Äåfor the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing ‚Äåmonetization for its artificial intelligence offerings. Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, Adobe ‚Äçhas made heavy bets on generative AI with its Firefly tool, which can be integrated ‚Äãacross the company's Creative Cloud¬†suite ‚Äåto create images and videos, in an attempt to draw users in. The forecast could potentially allay some investor ‚Äçfears that ‚Å†Adobe's rate of AI monetization would leave the software giant trailing Figma ‚Å†and other newer players in the market.

headline: Adobe sees upbeat annual results on AI, design software strength
summary: Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, signaling strong demand ‚Äãfor the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing monetization ‚Äåfor its artificial intelligence offerings.  Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, Adobe has made ‚Äåheavy bets on generative AI with its Firefly tool, which can be integrated across the company's Creative Cloud¬†suite to create images and videos, in an attempt to draw users in.  While Adobe's products have ‚Å†become a staple for ‚Äåstudents, creatives and enterprises, the company is grappling with rising competition in the industry it dominates, with ‚ÄçAI proliferation allowing rivals to rapidly grow their businesses and win contracts.

content.title: Adobe sees upbeat annual results on AI, design software strength
content.summary: Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, signaling strong demand ‚Äãfor the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing monetization ‚Äåfor its artificial intelligence offerings.  Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, Adobe has made ‚Äåheavy bets on generative AI with its Firefly tool, which can be integrated across the company's Creative Cloud¬†suite to create images and videos, in an attempt to draw users in.  While Adobe's products have ‚Å†become a staple for ‚Äåstudents, creatives and enterprises, the company is grappling with rising competition in the industry it dominates, with ‚ÄçAI proliferation allowing rivals to rapidly grow their businesses and win contracts.

headline: Adobe (ADBE) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: In fiscal 2025, Adobe delivered significant AI-influenced and AI-first ending ARR, which accelerated through the year.  With the Firefly application, we're giving creators a rich set of generative AI capabilities that allow users to generate with Adobe and partner models, ideate with Firefly boards, and create and edit videos and images through conversational experiences blended with direct manipulation.

content.title: Adobe (ADBE) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
content.summary: In fiscal 2025, Adobe delivered significant AI-influenced and AI-first ending ARR, which accelerated through the year.  With the Firefly application, we're giving creators a rich set of generative AI capabilities that allow users to generate with Adobe and partner models, ideate with Firefly boards, and create and edit videos and images through conversational experiences blended with direct manipulation.

headline: Cleo Capital's Kunst on Adobe, Synopsys and Oracle
summary: Sarah Kunst, Managing Director and Founder of Cleo Capital, says it's getting harder to see significant growth ahead for Adobe's core subscription business for its creative tools after Google released its Nana Banana Pro offering. She speaks with Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on "The Close."

headline: Wall Street awaits Fed's rate decision, lookahead to Oracle earnings
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a glance at the day's biggest developing market stories ahead of the opening bell on December 10, 2025. Yahoo Finance's team of expert reporters break down the latest forecasts surrounding the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision to come later today and corporate earnings results from Oracle (ORCL) and Adobe (ADBE). QI Research CEO and Chief Strategist Danielle DiMartino Booth comes on to discuss the outlook around the Fed's monetary policy heading into 2026, while commenting on the leadership change the US central bank could see as President Trump begins final interviews for his Fed chair nominee. She is the former advisor to former Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Richard Fisher. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

QI Research CEO and Chief Strategist Danielle DiMartino Booth comes on to discuss the outlook around the Fed's monetary policy heading into 2026, while commenting on the leadership change the US central bank could see as President Trump begins final interviews for his Fed chair nominee. She is the former advisor to former Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Richard Fisher.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more¬†Morning Brief.
